component.name: nats
component.title: Nats
component.description: Send and receive messages from NATS messaging system.
component.label: messaging

servers.description: URLs to one or more NAT servers. Use comma to separate URLs when specifying multiple servers.

verbose.description: Whether or not running in verbose mode

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

useGlobalSslContextParameters.label: security
useGlobalSslContextParameters.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

topic.description: The name of topic we want to use

flushConnection.label: common
flushConnection.description: Define if we want to flush connection when stopping or not

maxPingsOut.label: common
maxPingsOut.description: maximum number of pings have not received a response allowed by the client

noEcho.description: Turn off echo. If supported by the gnatsd version you are connecting to this flag will prevent the server from echoing messages back to the connection if it has subscriptions on the subject being published to.

noRandomizeServers.description: Whether or not randomizing the order of servers for the connection attempts

pedantic.label: common
pedantic.description: Whether or not running in pedantic mode (this affects performance)

pingInterval.description: Ping interval to be aware if connection is still alive (in milliseconds)

reconnect.label: common
reconnect.description: Whether or not using reconnection feature

reconnectTimeWait.label: common
reconnectTimeWait.description: Waiting time before attempts reconnection (in milliseconds)

requestCleanupInterval.label: common
requestCleanupInterval.description: Interval to clean up cancelled/timed out requests.

servers.label: common
servers.description: URLs to one or more NAT servers. Use comma to separate URLs when specifying multiple servers.

verbose.description: Whether or not running in verbose mode

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

maxMessages.label: consumer
maxMessages.description: Stop receiving messages from a topic we are subscribing to after maxMessages

queueName.label: consumer
queueName.description: The Queue name if we are using nats for a queue configuration

replyToDisabled.label: consumer
replyToDisabled.description: Can be used to turn off sending back reply message in the consumer.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

replySubject.label: producer
replySubject.description: the subject to which subscribers should send response

connection.label: advanced
connection.description: Reference an already instantiated connection to Nats server

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

traceConnection.label: advanced
traceConnection.description: Whether or not connection trace messages should be printed to standard out for fine grained debugging of connection issues.

secure.label: security
secure.description: Set secure option indicating TLS is required
